sections.instructions: Questions 11–12: Choose TWO letters A–E. Questions 13–15: Choose the correct letter A, B or C. Questions 16–20: Choose FIVE letters A–G.
sections.title: School's extended hours childcare service / Activities on offer

questions.question: Which TWO facts are given about the school's extended hours childcare service?
options: B More children attend after school than before school.
C An average of 50 children attend in the mornings.
D A child cannot attend both the before and after school sessions.
E The maximum number of children who can attend is 70.

questions.question: How much does childcare cost for a complete afternoon session per child?
What does the manager say about food?
options: A Children with allergies should bring their own food.
B Children may bring healthy snacks with them.
C Children are given a proper meal at 5 p.m.

questions.question: What is different about arrangements in the school holidays?
options: A Children from other schools can attend.
C A greater number of children can attend.

sections.instructions: Questions 21–24: Choose the correct letter A, B or C. Questions 25–30: Choose SIX letters A–H.
sections.title: Holly's Work Placement Tutorial

questions.question: Holly has chosen the Orion Stadium placement because
Which aspect of safety does Dr Green emphasise most?
options: A ensuring children stay in the stadium
B checking the equipment children will use
C removing obstacles in changing rooms

questions.question: What does Dr Green say about the spectators?
options: A They can be hard to manage.

Organisation

sections.instructions: Write ONE WORD ONLY for each answer.
sections.title: Bird Migration Theory

questions.question: It was believed that birds hibernated underwater or buried themselves in ____.
In autumn he observed that redstarts experience the loss of ____.
the two species of birds had a similar ____.
Charles Morton popularised the idea that birds fly to the ____ in winter.
a stork was killed in Germany which had an African spear in its ____.
previously there had been no ____ that storks migrate to Africa.
Little was known about the ____ and journeys of migrating birds
travelling across huge ____.
Ringing depended on what is called the '____' of dead birds.
In 1931, the first ____ to show the migration of European birds was printed.
